entry.title: Combined summary - Ivy: a higher-level language targeting Bitcoin Script
entry.summary: The Bitcoin community has released Ivy, a prototype higher-level language and development environment for creating custom Bitcoin Script programs. Ivy aims to improve the usability of Bitcoin Script by adding named variables and clauses, static types, and familiar syntax for function calls. It can compile to Bitcoin Script and is intended for educational and research purposes only. Ivy Playground for Bitcoin allows users to create and test simulated contracts in a sandboxed environment. The compiler only produces SegWit addresses; however, there was an issue with how the compiler was handling clause selection that led to a minor witness malleability problem. This problem has been fixed in version 0.0.7 of the compiler. A user suggested adding some form of compiler-time enforcement to prevent witness malleability, but the team believes it would be easier to build a static analyzer for low-level Bitcoin Script. Ivy is a prototype software, so it should not be used to control real or testnet Bitcoins.
